document_structure.file_naming_pattern: Files are named using a combination of chapter numbers (e.g., '01', '02') and descriptive titles (e.g., 'Alpha', 'Momentum'), with some files indicating their purpose such as 'Sample Midterm 1', 'Sample Midterm 1 - Answers', and others placed in subdirectories reflecting broader topics (e.g., '06 Liquidity and Liquidity Risk')

chapters.name: Midterm Exams
chapters.description: This section contains two full-length sample midterm exams and their corresponding answer keys, as well as a set of midterm answers. These materials are designed for exam preparation and assessment, covering multiple-choice and short-answer questions related to empirical finance topics.

chapters.name: Alpha
chapters.description: This chapter introduces the concept of alpha in the context of the Capital Asset Pricing Model (CAPM), discussing its theoretical foundation, empirical interpretation, and implications for investment strategies.

chapters.name: Return Predictability
chapters.description: This chapter explores the predictability of market returns, focusing on economic indicators such as term spread, dividend yield, and default premium. It also discusses the behavioral and EMH-based interpretations of return predictability.

chapters.name: Conditional CAPM
chapters.description: This chapter introduces the Conditional CAPM (ICAPM), examining how market risk and beta can vary over time and how investors hedge against macroeconomic risks.

chapters.name: Intertemporal CAPM
chapters.description: This chapter extends the CAPM to intertemporal settings, focusing on how consumption, inflation, and volatility risk influence asset pricing and expected returns.

chapters.name: EMH and Trading Costs
files: 05 EMH and Trading Costs\05 EMH and Trading Costs.md
chapters.description: This chapter discusses the Efficient Market Hypothesis (EMH) in the context of trading costs such as bid-ask spreads and price impact, and how these costs affect the feasibility of exploiting anomalies.

chapters.name: Liquidity and Liquidity Risk
files: 06 Liquidity and Liquidity Risk\06 Liquidity and Liquidity Risk.md
06 Liquidity and Liquidity Risk\12 Liquidity and Asset Prices.md
chapters.description: This chapter covers the theory and empirical evidence on liquidity risk, including how liquidity affects asset pricing and the role of trading costs in determining expected returns.

chapters.name: Anomalies: Introduction
chapters.description: This chapter introduces the concept of market anomalies, distinguishing between rational and behavioral explanations, and explores whether anomalies represent mispricing or risk factors.

chapters.name: Momentum
chapters.description: This chapter focuses on the momentum effect in stock returns, discussing both rational and behavioral explanations, and evaluating its persistence and robustness across different market conditions.

key_observations: The course materials are organized both by topic (e.g., Alpha, Momentum) and by assessment type (e.g., Sample Midterms and Answers), indicating a mixed structure.
Most files contain detailed theoretical explanations and empirical examples, with a strong emphasis on financial formulas and economic intuition, though code and tables are rare.
The presence of multiple midterms and answer keys suggests a strong focus on student assessment and understanding of core empirical finance concepts.
